title.narrative: 12 DRR - COVID-19

description.narrative: Government and partners have the capacities and technical resources to coordinate, plan for, respond and mitigate any adverse impacts due to COVID-19, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation (Covid), Reducing Child Poverty, Reducing Child Poverty (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: India Country Programme is effectively and efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and partners have the capacities and technical resources to coordinate, plan for, respond and mitigate any adverseimpacts due to COVID-19

description.narrative: The overlapping COVID-19 second wave crisis compounded by multiple hydro-meteorological hazards had critical impact on the health ;stretching the capacities of government and humanitarian organizations to respond. ;UNICEF targeted at strengthening systemic preparedness and response capabilities of the key departments of the government, and other stakeholders to ensure ;social sector service continue uninterrupted. UNICEF and its partners ;assisted the government and its key departments to deliver results for 664 million vulnerable population and 286 million children by building capacities of departments and CSOs to adopt preparedness for response. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/01/2022
